Detailed Description

At the moment this class uses really lame associative arrays to keep track of messages and attributes.

Even lamer is that we statically limit it to 16 of each right now. Eventually we will do this with something way better...

Member Function Documentation

TTErr TTObject::registerAttribute ( const TTSymbol &  name,
TTDataType  type,
void *  address 
)

The theory on attributes is that the subclass calls registerAttribute() and the base class manages a list of all registered attributes.

The the end-user calls setAttribute() on the object (which is defined in the base class only) and it dispatches the message as appropriate.
